trans-unit.source: Represents a configuration file that is applicable to a particular computer, application, or resource.
This class cannot be inherited.
Configuration settings are stored in a hierarchy of configuration files.

The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> class instance represents the merged view of the configuration settings from all of the configuration files that apply to a specific physical entity, such as a computer, or to a logical entity, such as an application or a Web site.
The logical entity can exist on the local computer or on a remote server.

For information about configuration files, see [Configuring Apps](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/86bd26d3-737e-4484-9782-19b17f34cd1f) and [ASP.NET Configuration Files](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01505090-9114-41a7-93ca-068e2283ed3d).
When no configuration file exists for a specified entity, the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object represents the default configuration settings as defined by the Machine.config file.
You can get a <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object by using the following classes:
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager> class, if your entity is a client application.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager> class, if your entity is a Web application.
The names of the methods that return a <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object begin with "Open".
You can also generate a configuration file that represents the configuration settings in a <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object.
To do this, use one of the following methods:
Call the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> method to create a new configuration file.
Call the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.SaveAs%2A> method to generate a new configuration file at another location.
The names of the methods that create configuration files begin with "Save".
To enable access to configuration settings on a remote computer, use the Aspnet_regiis command-line tool.
For more information about this tool, see [ASP.NET IIS Registration Tool (Aspnet_regiis.exe)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6491c41e-e2b0-481f-9863-db3614d5f96b).
For information about creating and accessing custom configuration settings other than the intrinsic sections included in the .NET Framework, refer to <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection"></xref> object configuration section that applies to this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.AppSettings%2A> property to access and change the `appSettings` configuration section defined by default in the open configuration file.

An <xref href="System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection"></xref> object representing the `appSettings` configuration section that applies to this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Specifies a function delegate that is used to transform assembly strings in configuration files.
This property enables a consumer of the .NET Framework configuration system to set a function delegate that is used to transform assembly strings found in configuration files.
[!INCLUDE[vs_dev10_long](~/includes/vs-dev10-long-md.md)] uses this property when a project is targeted for an earlier version of the .NET Framework.
The function makes sure that assembly strings are formatted correctly for the targeted version of the .NET Framework when configuration files are updated.
A delegate that transforms type strings.
The default value is `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConnectionStringsSection"></xref> configuration-section object that applies to this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.ConnectionStrings%2A> property to access and change the `connectionStrings` configuration section defined in the open configuration file.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConnectionStringsSection"></xref> configuration-section object representing the `connectionStrings` configuration section that applies to this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Gets the <xref href="System.Configuration.ContextInformation"></xref> object for the <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
A <xref:System.Configuration.ContextInformation> object provides the context necessary for a <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object to respond based upon where it is being evaluated.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ContextInformation"></xref> object for the <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Gets the physical path to the configuration file represented by this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.

If the value for this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property represents a merged view and no actual file exists for the application, the path to the parent configuration file is returned.
The physical path to the configuration file represented by this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Returns the specified <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection"></xref> object.
Configuration settings are contained within sections that group similar settings together for convenience.
The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method retrieves a configuration section by its name.
The specified <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection"></xref> object.
Gets the specified <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSectionGroup%2A> method to obtain a specific <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> from a <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> specified.
Gets a value that indicates whether a file exists for the resource represented by this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.HasFile%2A> property also returns `true` when the resource represented by this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object inherits settings from a Web.config file.
The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.HasFile%2A> property returns `false` when this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object represents a location-specific configuration.
`true` if there is a configuration file; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the locations defined within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Locations%2A> property applies only when the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.HasFile%2A> property returns `true`.
If this configuration inherits all of its settings, or no locations are defined, an empty collection is returned.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationLocationCollection"></xref> containing the locations defined within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the configuration file has an XML namespace.
Configuration files are formatted as XML files, but an XML namespace is not required.
If this value is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object is opened, then the file contains a namespace reference.
If it is set to `true` before the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object is saved, then a namespace reference will be added to the file.
`true` if the configuration file has an XML namespace; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the root <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
The root section group for this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Writes the configuration settings contained within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object to the current XML configuration file.
The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> method persists any configuration settings that have been modified since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created.

If a configuration file does not exist at the physical location represented by the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property, a new configuration file will be created to contain any settings that are different from the inherited configuration.
If the configuration file has changed since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created, a run-time error occurs.

When 'Creator Owner' is listed in the ACL (Access Control List) of the directory containing the configuration file, the current user of <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> becomes the new owner of the file and inherits the permissions granted to 'Creator Owner'.
This results in an elevation of privileges for the current user and a removal of privileges for the previous owner.
The configuration file could not be written to.
\- or -
The configuration file has changed.
Writes the configuration settings contained within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object to the current XML configuration file.
The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> method persists configuration settings in the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object based on the `saveMode` parameter.

If a configuration file does not exist at the physical location represented by the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property, a new configuration file will be created to contain any settings that are different from the inherited configuration.
If the configuration file has changed since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created, a run-time error occurs.

When 'Creator Owner' is listed in the ACL (Access Control List) of the directory containing the configuration file, the current user of <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> becomes the new owner of the file and inherits the permissions granted to 'Creator Owner'.
This results in an elevation of privileges for the current user and a removal of privileges for the previous owner.
The configuration file could not be written to.
\- or -
The configuration file has changed.
Writes the configuration settings contained within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object to the current XML configuration file.

The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> method persists configuration settings in the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object based on the `saveMode` and `forceSaveAll` parameters.

If a configuration file does not exist at the physical location represented by the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property, a new configuration file will be created to contain any settings that are different from the inherited configuration..
If the configuration file has changed since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created, a run-time error occurs.

When 'Creator Owner' is listed in the ACL (Access Control List) of the directory containing the configuration file, the current user of <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> becomes the new owner of the file and inherits the permissions granted to 'Creator Owner'.
This results in an elevation of privileges for the current user and a removal of privileges for the previous owner.
The configuration file could not be written to.
\- or -
The configuration file has changed.
Writes the configuration settings contained within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object to the specified XML configuration file.

The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.SaveAs%2A> method persists any configuration settings that have been modified since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created to a new file.
If a configuration file does not exist at the physical location represented by the
<xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property, a new configuration file will be created to contain any settings that are different from the inherited configuration..
If the configuration file has changed since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created, a run-time error occurs.
The path and file name to save the configuration file to.
The configuration file could not be written to.
\- or -
The configuration file has changed.
Writes the configuration settings contained within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object to the specified XML configuration file.
The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.SaveAs%2A> method persists configuration settings in the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object to a new file based on the `saveMode` parameter.

If a configuration file does not exist at the physical location represented by the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property, a new configuration file will be created to contain any settings that are different from the inherited configuration..
If the configuration file has changed since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created, a run-time error occurs.
The path and file name to save the configuration file to.
The configuration file could not be written to.
\- or -
The configuration file has changed.
Writes the configuration settings contained within this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object to the specified XML configuration file.

The <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.SaveAs%2A> method persists configuration settings in the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object to a new file based on the `saveMode` and `forceSaveAll` parameters.

If a configuration file does not exist at the physical location represented by the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.FilePath%2A> property, a new configuration file will be created to contain any settings that are different from the inherited configuration.
If the configuration file has changed since this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object was created, a run-time error occurs.
The path and file name to save the configuration file to.
filename is null or an empty string ("").
Gets a collection of the section groups defined by this configuration.
Configuration sections can be combined into groups for convenience and added functionality.

Access the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.SectionGroups%2A> property to retrieve the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroupCollection> object representing the collection of section groups for this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object.
If this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object represents an inherited view, the merged list of section groups will be returned.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroupCollection"></xref> collection representing the collection of section groups for this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Gets a collection of the sections defined by this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.

Access the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Sections%2A> property to retrieve a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionCollection> object representing the collection of sections for this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object.
If this <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration> object represents a merged configuration, the merged list of sections will be returned.
A collection of the sections defined by this <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> object.
Specifies the targeted version of the .NET Framework when a version earlier than the current one is targeted.
When the configuration system serializes a hierarchy of configuration objects to XML, it checks the value of this property.
If the property is not `null`, the configuration system performs version checks for each configuration section group and configuration section.
The configuration system also performs version checks for individual configuration properties that are marked as having changed across versions.
(For more information, see <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions>.) The configuration system also performs version checks for configuration elements in configuration sections.
If the value of this property is `null`, the configuration system does not perform any version checks during serialization.
The name of the targeted version of the .NET Framework.
The default value is `null`, which indicates that the current version is targeted.
Specifies a function delegate that is used to transform type strings in configuration files.
This property enables a consumer of the .NET Framework configuration system to set a function delegate that is used to transform type strings found in configuration files.
[!INCLUDE[vs_dev10_long](~/includes/vs-dev10-long-md.md)] uses this property when a project is targeted for an earlier version of the .NET Framework.
The function makes sure that type strings are formatted correctly for the targeted version of the .NET Framework when configuration files are updated.
A delegate that transforms type strings.
The default value is `null`.
